description.narrative: Preparation of St Kitts and Nevis' Second National Communication to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent to which implementation of comprehensive measures - plans, strategies, policies, programmes and budgets - to achieve low-emission and climate-resilient development objectives has improved.

The project is closely linked to development objectives being pursued at national and regional levels in areas such as disaster prevention, public health, food production, land-use planning and development of renewable energy sources.

description.narrative: Area of terrestrial ecosystems in St. Kitts and Nevis under official protection Area of marine ecosystems in St. Kitts and Nevis under official protection No of PA staff with specialised training and/or skills development $ per year in PA management funds for PA units generated from visitor, user and concession fees

comment.narrative: 5,260 hectares at 2 existing sites of terrestrial PAs 0 hectares of marine PAs 2 fisheries staff have specialised training $0 in PA management funds for PA units generated from visitor, user and concession fees

1. Complete the updating of the National Conservation and Environment Management Bill (NCEMB) 2. Establishment of Protected Areas Agency (PAA) 3. Implementation of a communications strategy 4. Operationalization of Terrestrial Protected Areas Sites

1. A legal consultant was contracted to update the NCEMB. She has produced two drafts of the bill and organized four public consultations inviting various stakeholders and general public. Because this public consultation process has been taking longer than initially anticipated, the NCEMB has not been finalized. Nevertheless, the consultant plans to submit the final draft to the Parliament for consideration by the end of 2016.
2. The initial plan was to establish a Protected Areas Agency (PAA) as a statutory body to manage all protected areas. Due to some misgivings on how this body will function, however, a PAA committee was established for the purpose of substituting for the PAA. Discussions are ongoing with the aim of making the PAA committee a unit in the Department of Environment.
3. A communications consultant was contracted and tasked with making a determination of target audiences and review relevant information to develop a communications strategy through a knowledge, attitude, perception and behavior (KAP/B) survey. There have been a number of challenges with this consultancy mainly due to misunderstandings about the scope of the Terms of Reference, which has caused significant delays in the development, administration, and interpretation of the data collected from the KAP/B survey. The CO office in the process of considering the possibility of terminating his contract due to his overall poor performance.
4. Five park rangers (all men, 1 in Nevis) were employed from June 2016 and have been working at the Central Forest Reserve Office. A training module has been developed for the rangers, which include topics such as introduction to botany and forestry, first aid, light search and rescue, tour guiding, basic police training, ethics and artifacts. They continue to engage in the development of periodical work plans and assessment exercises and catalog the flora and fauna at various trails within Protected Areas and. That is how the rangers contribute to t

1. Submission of the Draft National Conservation and Environment Management Bill (NCEMB) to Cabinet 2. Establishment of Protected Areas Agency (PAA) 3. Development of Protected Areas Sustainable Financing Mechanism and Strategy 4. Implementation of a communications strategy 5. Operationalization of Marine Protected Areas Sites

1. Submission of the Draft National Conservation and Environment Management Bill (NCEMB) to Cabinet The Department of Environment submitted the draft Bill to the Ministry of Legal Affairs in anticipation of if being vetted for accurate legal language and alignment with other pieces of legislation before it is sent to Cabinet for approval.
2. Establishment of Protected Areas Agency (PAA) The decision on the PAA is still outstanding, it is expected that the upcoming Protected Areas capacity assessment, staff development and institutional arrangement consultancy will assist decision makers to establish the PAA.
3. Development of Protected Areas Sustainable Financing Mechanism and Strategy The Protected Areas sustainable financing mechanism/plan was developed and presented. The Department of Environment is tasked with the responsibility of presenting the plan to the Minister of Agriculture for acceptance.
4. Implementation of a communications strategy With support from the communication consultant and various members of the Project Steering Committee, the media launch was held during the week of 10th to 13th October. Materials developed for this event were shared with project stakeholders and a request was made for information be shared on their social media platforms, so far St. Christopher National Trust, Nevis Historical and Conservation Society, UNDP and Department of Environment have agreed.
5. Operationalization of Marine Protected Areas Sites Two Beach (1 male, 1 female) and four Marine (1 male, 3 females) Conservation Officers were recruited and are integrating well with the Department of Marine Resources. They are involved in the preparation of and presentation of information on marine resources to fisher folk and students at various schools on St. Kitts.
The marine monitoring/research vessel has been constructed and is due to arrive in the Federation early January, 2018.
